eu.zidek.augustin.minuscule

Class MGeometricObject

  • java.lang.Object
    • eu.zidek.augustin.minuscule.MGeometricObject
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<MGeometricObject>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    MLabel, MLine, MPoint, MPolygon, MRectangle, MShape

    public abstract class MGeometricObject
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<MGeometricObject>
    The most general interface for all geometric objects the canvas supports. Every object that wants to draw on the canvas should implement this interface. The compareTo() method uses the information about the object's layer to impose total order. This is used heavily in the Canvas to display objects in the right z-order.
    Author:
    Augustin Zidek

    • Method Detail

      • getColor

        public java.awt.Color getColor()
        Returns:
        The color of the geometric object. If none set returns the concrete object's default color.

      • isFill

        public boolean isFill()
        Returns:
        true if the geometric object is filled, false otherwise

      • getLabel

        public MLabel getLabel()
        Returns:
        The label of this geometric object. If none, returns null.

      • getStroke

        public java.awt.Stroke getStroke()
        Returns:
        The stroke used by this object. If none set returns the concrete object's default stroke.

      • getLayer

        public int getLayer()
        Returns:
        The layer of the object. The higher layer number, the later the object is drawn - e.g. object at layer 0 will be under object at layer 4.
        The default layer value is determined by the type of the geometric object (points are at layer 1, label 2, all other objects 0).

      • draw

        public abstract MGeometricObject draw(Canvas canvas)
        Adds the object into the internal list of objects in the canvas and calls the repaint() method of the Canvas. Any modifications to the geometric object done after calling this method will be ignored (e.g. MPoint.draw(canvas).x(20).y(20);) will draw the point at the default (0, 0) coordinates).
        Parameters:
        canvas - The canvas on which the object should be drawn
        Returns:
        The object that has been drawn

      • color

        public abstract MGeometricObject color(java.awt.Color color)
        Sets the object's color to the given color. If not called upon an object, the object's default color is used - see documentation for individual objects.
        Parameters:
        color - The new color to be set
        Returns:
        The object which color has been set

      • fill

        public abstract MGeometricObject fill(boolean value)
        Changes the property of the object so that it will be filled rather when being drawn. If not called upon an object, the object's default value is used - see documentation for individual objects.
        Parameters:
        value - true if the object should be filled, false otherwise
        Returns:
        The object which has been set/unset to be filled

      • stroke

        public abstract MGeometricObject stroke(java.awt.Stroke stroke)
        Sets the object's stroke. Stroke modifies the pen that draws the object, e.g. one can modify the thickness of the pen.
        Parameters:
        stroke - The stroke to be used when drawing this object. If not called, default Minuscule Stroke will be used.
        Returns:
        The object which has the given stroke applied
        See Also:
        Stroke

      • layer

        public abstract MGeometricObject layer(int layer)
        Sets the object's layer to the given value. The layer determines when the object is drawn - the higher layer, the later the object will be drawn.
        Parameters:
        layer - The layer number
        Returns:
        The object with layer set

      • label

        public abstract MGeometricObject label(java.lang.String labelText)
        Adds a label with default color, default font family and default font size located northeast relative to the object. If the object already has any label, it will be replaced by this label.
        Parameters:
        labelText - The label string value
        Returns:
        The object with the label set

      • label

        public abstract MGeometricObject label(java.lang.String labelText,
                                       double angleDeg)
        Adds a label with default color, default font family and default font size located according to the location parameter. If the object already has any label, it will be replaced by this label.
        Parameters:
        labelText - The label string value
        angleDeg - The angle relative to the x-axis in positive direction at which the label should be placed according to the object's properties
        Returns:
        The object with the label set

      • label

        public abstract MGeometricObject label(MLabel label)
        Adds a custom label to the object, sets the object as its parent. That means that the label coordinates will be now relative to the parent's Label Base Coordinate. If the object already has any label, it will be replaced by this label. If you want the object to determine the label position for you automatically, use either label(String s) method or label(String s, int pos) method.
        Parameters:
        label - The label to be added to the object
        Returns:
        The object with the label set

      • translate

        public abstract MGeometricObject translate(double dx,
                                           double dy)
        Translates the object by the given translation vector.
        Parameters:
        dx - The translation in the x direction
        dy - The translation in the y direction
        Returns:
        The translated object

      • getLabelBaseCoordinate

        public abstract MCoordinate getLabelBaseCoordinate()
        If a label is on its own (i.e. it doesn't have a parent), its position is absolute. However, if label has a parent, then its position is relative to a certain point defined by the parent. This method returns such a point. For instance, for a point centered at (10,10), the label base coordinate point is also at (10,10) and the label's position is for instance set to (5,5) relative to its parent's base coordinate. Hence the absolute label's position will be (15,15). Other examples: For line the label base point is defined at the midpoint. For square as its middle.
        Returns:
        The coordinate of the label base point

      • getLabelCoordinates

        public abstract MCoordinate getLabelCoordinates(double angleDeg)
        Returns the relative coordinates for a label of this object at the given angle given in degrees. The method should make sure that the coordinates put the label in such place that it is visually nicely placed relative to the object.
        Parameters:
        angleDeg - The angle at which the label should be put
        Returns:
        The coordinates of the label according to the given angle and the properties of the object

      • delete

        public void delete(Canvas canvas)
        Deletes the given object from the canvas. Also all objects which this object is parent to will be deleted.
        Parameters:
        canvas - The canvas from which the object should be deleted

      • getBoundingRectangle

        public abstract MBoundingBox getBoundingRectangle()
        Calculates the bounding rectangle of the given geometric object and returns it. The coordinates are absolute (i.e. relative to the origin, not to the parent object).
        Returns:
        The bounding rectangle of the geometric object.

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo(MGeometricObject obj)
        Specified by:
        compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable<MGeometricObject>
